results.title: Tennis basics: the serve
results.brief_description: The serve is demonstrated by Dennis Ralston, and then the exact positions of each part of the body at every stage in the swing is shown. The precise movements are then repeated entirely in slow motion with frequent use of “freeze frames” for clear visualisation.

results.title: Tennis basics: the forehand
results.brief_description: Dennis Ralston introduces the film by demonstrating the basic forehand stroke and encouraging students to feel the movements as they are pictured. Animation shows the exact positions of each part of the body at every stage of the swing.

results.title: Tennis basics: the backhand
results.brief_description: American tennis professional Dennis Ralston demonstrates the backhand stroke. Simple animated figures are used to show the basic positions of the arms, legs, body and head during each phase of the swing. Viewer participation is also included.

results.title: Tennessee Williams: theater in process
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Educational Corporation, Signet Productions, Suzanne Tedesko and Richard Slote
results.brief_description: A behind-the-scenes look at the production of the play “The red devil battery sign” by Tennessee Williams. Tennessee Williams talks about his career and about writing a play and how he works with a director rather than with the actors. The film shows a press conference, rehearsals of lines and then full rehearsals during which the director conveys his interpretation of some of the important symbols and speeches in the play

results.title: Tennessee volunteers
results.brief_description: A project was sponsored by the University of Tennessee to build a children’s playground with the help of the community. In this way, building costs were low, and children involved gained more respect for the equipment, having helped to build it. Members of the community brought their own tools and gave their time, whilst local businesses donated equipment and the use of machinery.

results.title: Tennant Creek in passing
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Frank Bagnall and James Coffey
results.brief_description: This film views Tennant Creek in the form of a passing glimpse, beginning with some long-shot filming of the natural environment and mines at sunrise in an approach to the town, focusing on buildings, inhabitants, passing vehicles and travellers, and completing the view with aerial shots moving away from Tennant Creek at sunset.

results.title: Tenebrae
results.creator_credit: Sigma Cinematografica, Claudio Argento and Dario Argento
results.brief_description: For the uninitiated, Italian horror director Dario Argento (or the Italian Hitchcock as he is affectionately referred as by his fans) has fashioned a career on very stylish and very violent ‘Giallo’ thrillers. Tenebrae is classic Argento featuring intricately orchestrated deaths, perverse pathologies and labyrinth plotting. American mystery writer Peter Neil (Anthony Franciosa) finds himself the target of a serial killer while on a promotional tour in Rome. It seems that the murderer is literally taking a leaf out of Neil’s book by stuffing pages of his latest thriller into the victims mouths. Neil soon finds himself embroiled in the killers sick fantasies and a prime police suspect. Argento in the past has come under considerable fire with feminists and critics who have felt that his unrelenting carnage of women in his films borders on rampant misogyny. Tenebrae isn’t so much an answer to feminists but a provocative and cheeky slap in the face, offering even more elaborate female mutilation, castrating temptresses in red stilettos and a lesbian feminist critic who meets a horrible and violent end. Music by Goblin. Cast includes: Christian Borromeo, Mirella D’Angelo, Veronica Lario, John Saxon, Ania Pieroni.

results.title: Tender mercies
results.creator_credit: EMI/Parlophone, Antron Media, Horton Foote, Robert Duvall and Bruce Beresford
results.brief_description: A compassionate love story tracing the relationship between a burnt-out country and western star and a young widow he meets in a Texas motel. His past is littered with the spoils of fame and scarred by alcoholism, two broken marriages and a painful descent from stardom so that he lacks confidence in relationships and has a low opinion of himself and others. The widow and her young son help him to rebuild his life and to appreciate the healing power of affection. Stars Robert Duvall and Tess Harper.
results.creator_credit_for_label: EMI/Parlophone, Antron Media, Horton Foote, Robert Duvall and Bruce Beresford

results.title: Tender loving care
results.creator_credit: Aftermath Media, Rob Landeros and David Wheeler
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Andrew Neiderman and directed by David Wheeler, “Tender loving care” is an interactive movie where the viewer’s involvement can alter the outcome. The story revolves around the Overton couple who are suffering the trauma of a personal tragedy. When a psychiatric nurse comes to their aid, all sorts of mysteries and secrets begin to unfold. In between scenes the view is given thematic apperception tests about the characters and also personal views and interpretations. Clues are also discovered by navigating through the 3D environments or certain parts in the film. Guided by Doctor Turner (John Hurt), your journey through “Tender Loving Care” is a psychological experience that changes each time you play. Cast includes Michael Esposito, Beth Tegarden and Marie Caldare.

results.title: Tender is the night
results.brief_description: This lavish production of F. Scott Fitzgerald’s “Tender is the Night” is set against the sumptuous background of the playgrounds of Europe during the 1920s. Dick Diver, a brilliant young American psychiatrist, falls in love with Nicole Warren, a beautiful but schizophrenic American heiress. They make a stylish, glamorous couple and in the carnival atmosphere of the 1920s enjoy a lavish lifestyle on the French Riviera, in Paris and in Switzerland. This brings them a fascinating circle of friends, but rivalries and conflicting passions within the group strain their relationship and take a heavy toll on Nicole’s fragile health. For Dick, the intertwining of lives with Nicole ends in tragedy. Screenplay by Dennis Potter.
